intro: Jussiaea abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves and small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. It is often found in stream banks and rocky outcrops, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
